title: Google\Cloud\Compute\V1\AutoscalingPolicyScaleInControl
name: AutoscalingPolicyScaleInControl
description:
Configuration that allows for slower scale in so that even if Autoscaler recommends an abrupt scale in of a MIG, it will be throttled as specified by the parameters below.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.compute.v1.AutoscalingPolicyScaleInControl

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.max_scaled_in_replicas
params.description: Maximum allowed number (or %) of VMs that can be deducted from the peak recommendation during the window autoscaler looks at when computing recommendations. Possibly all these VMs can be deleted at once so user service needs to be prepared to lose that many VMs in one step.

params.name: data.time_window_sec
params.description: How far back autoscaling looks when computing recommendations to include directives regarding slower scale in, as described above.
